description:
Daizaburo Edi-Ban, a Japanese-American, joins New York City's toughest precinct, the 34th. On his first day he is partnered up with John Estes, called Sleepy by his friends and Mad Bull by his enemies, a cop who stops crime with his own violent brand of justice. Mad Bull makes no qualms about executing common thieves with shotgun blasts if they even pose a minor threat to him or anyone around them. Mad Bull also often steals from prostitutes and does incredible amounts of property damage while fighting crime. Mad Bull's unpoliceman-like behavior often puts him in hot water with his partner Daizaburo and the 34th precinct. However, despite how reckless or illegal these acts are, a good cause is always revealed (For example, Sleepy uses the money he steals from the prostitutes to fund a venereal disease clinic and a home for battered and raped women). Perrine Valley, a police lieutenant, joins Daizaburo and Sleepy later on to help them tackle more difficult cases involving the mafia and drug-running.

Mad Bull 34 is inspired by the high-action buddy cop films of the 70's and 80's.

- Thevinnymac, the badass from Ignition-One

node.description:
__Height__: 183 cm

[Reddit](https://www.reddit.com/user/Kazuo_Koike/)

Koike was a prolific Japanese manga writer, novelist and entrepreneur. 

Early in Koike's career, he studied under *Golgo 13* creator [Takao Saitou](https://anilist.co/staff/97907/Takao-Saitou) and served as a writer on the series. 

Koike, along with artist Goseki Kojima, made the manga [Kozure Ookami](https://anilist.co/manga/30904/Kozure-Ookami/), and Koike also contributed to the scripts for the 1970s film adaptations of the series, which starred famous Japanese actor Tomisaburo Wakayama. Koike and Kojima became known as the "Golden Duo" because of the success of Kozure Ookami.  Another series written by Koike, [Crying Freeman](https://anilist.co/manga/31449/Crying-Freeman/), which was illustrated by Ryoichi Ikegami, was adapted into a 1995 live-action film by French director Christophe Gans.  Kazuo Koike started the Gekika Sonjuku, a college course meant to teach people how to be mangaka.

In addition to his more violent, action-oriented manga, Koike, an avid golfer, has also written golf manga.
Not to be confused withe the [writer](https://anilist.co/staff/321582/Okazaki-Hideo)
Wrote the English scripts for Manga Entertainment. Wrote the English script for the UK Film, I Bought A Vampire Motorcycle.

After graduating from high school, Dezaki took a position at Toshiba while studying in the department of literature at Hosei University. While doing both of these, he continued to work on his dream job of working on movie production. He acted as the coach for the nine-member volleyball team at Toshiba. Dezaki also began pulling together an anime production team.

Dezaki resigned after working for seven years at Toshiba, leaving Hosei University in the middle of a term as well. He began working for [Gisaburou Sugii's](https://anilist.co/staff/103537) company Art Fresh, working alongside his younger brother [Osamu](https://anilist.co/staff/100393). His first works included writing the script for [Attack No.1](https://anilist.co/anime/1550) and storyboarding [Kyojin no Hoshi](https://anilist.co/anime/5834).

In 1969, Dezaki became a freelancer, doing scripting, production and direction work for [Tokyo Movie Shinsha](https://anilist.co/studio/65), [Tatsunoko Production](https://anilist.co/studio/103), and [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14). In 1977, he founded [Magic Bus](https://anilist.co/studio/207) and produced and animated [Shin Kyojin no Hoshi](https://anilist.co/anime/15875).

He is the older brother of [Osamu Dezaki](https://anilist.co/staff/100393), and the husband of [Setsuko Shibuichi](https://anilist.co/staff/101935/).

__Graduated:__ Tokyo Zokei University

Takizawa Toshifumi was a Japanese director, episode director and storyboard artist.

After he graduated Tokyo Zokei University, he got to work at Tokyo Animation Film, where he worked as part of a photography team. In later years he started working for Shin-Ei Douga, where he was a production assistant. After he started working at Nippon Sunrise, he became a director, giving his debut in 1985 with the Dirty Pair TV series. He continued working as a director afterwards, but as a freelancer instead.

He was a line director on the Ideon Be Invoked film, he was also involved in the Votoms series and has directed Gonzo's TV adaption of Kurosawa's epic Samurai 7 film, which he did in 2004.

Toshifumi passed away on June 22, 2015 from esophageal cancer. He was 61 years old when he died, and up until that point he would still be doing his ordinary activities like driving his car and walking his dog.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/noriyoshiinoue)

Inoue Noriyoshi was inspired to become a manga artist by the works of people such as [Mochizuki Mikiya](https://anilist.co/staff/98755), Matsumuto Leiji and [Monkey Punch](https://anilist.co/staff/97385), which he read in elementary school.

Youji Nishikawa is a former editor.

He suffered intracranial hemorrhage in 2004, and has since been disabled and unemployed.
